name: Hotel Diana Pompei

reviews.text: When we were due to catch the Circumvesuviana train from Pompeii to Sorrento, we returned to the hotel to get a taxi to the station. Alessandro, the staff member helping us, found out that there was a train strike. He then tried to find us a taxi to Sorrento, but when this failed went out of his way to help us by contacting a friend who drove us there (in his open topped car!) for an agreed, reasonable amount.
reviews.title: Extremely helpful
Favorite hotel on our trip
reviews.text: Getting to the hotel from the Circumvesuviana train on foot was complicated as we got off at the wrong station (Pompeii Scavi) - perhaps the hotel could give clear instructions on what train to get from Naples and what station to get off at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise, the hotel was perfect and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Great place, almost all is perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights as a base for seeing archaeological sites around Naples. Getting to the hotel from the Naples central train station was an adventure. In spite of great directions from the hotel, the staff at the station's tourist info and at TrenItalia couldn't provide us with sufficient info/directions to find the correct train/track. Our room was on the 1st floor of a building next door to the main building. The room size was average with a stand-up cabinet for a closet and a good size bathroom with a nice shower and toilet+bidet. The complimentary Wi-fi wasn't available in the room, but there was good reception in the lobby & hotel garden. The staff (Claudia & Alessandro) were enthusiastic, friendly and extremely helpful. They helped us plan our daily activities with detailed directions and train time tables. With their assistance, getting to Naples (National Archaeological Museum & L'Antica Pizzaria Da Michele), Ercolano (Herculeum), Pasteum and Sorrento was very smooth. We really enjoyed the breakfast everyday. The hotel is in the city of Pompeii which is small & quaint with the archaeological site, a large church, and many souvenir stands - even a Carrefour market. Many restaurants nearby are filled with locals. We really liked the pizza restaurant (Jerome Pizza) across street. Overall, it was our favorite hotel during our 2 wk trip. We would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Friendly staff - I'd give 3 1/2 stars if I could

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is ran (or at least it appears to be so) by a bunch of young(er) people who are very enthusiastic about what they do. They all speak english and are alwaysa eager to help - no matter with what. Whether it is your AC in the room or to tell you what is the place to visit in Naples. I would recommend it to all. If I ever come to Pompeii again (and this was my second time), I am staying here again!
reviews.title: OK Stay for One Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and myself stayed for six nights from the 7th September and i must say we were pleasantly surprised considering the reasonable price. The rooms are very clean, comfortable. The staff are beyond nice and helpful, they happily helped us plan each day with great enthusiasm. Even better is the location of the hotel, being only 2 min walk from the station, 2 min from the main square and 5 min from the ruins. Plus there are two amazing restaurants just around the corner.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing we loved about the hotel was that it is not too big and so a pleasant atmosphere was experienced at all times. If i had to say anything bad about the place, it would be the mosquito's, although they are everywhere and the hotel staff were very proactive in deterring them from the beautiful garden area.
reviews.title: service above and beyond

reviews.text: I would not stay anywhere else in this part of Italy, so well located for all of the must see attractions.
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.text: Thank you, will be back.
reviews.title: Nice people, good rooms, convenient location

reviews.text: my wife and i recently stayed at this hotel for one week to see the the ruins of pompeii and herculaneum. the room was clean and comfortable. the garden terrace was very nice ( but watch out for the mosquitos! - although the staff did put out insect repellent burners ) .all the staff were very helpful and spoke pretty good english but a special mention goes to allessandro in my time of need.when flying into naples airport i suffered a severe headache which lasted for a few days. allessandro very kindly took me and my wife to the hospital in the next town in his own car and at his own expense. he stayed with us and acted as an interpreter for us to tell them what had happened. after the hospital had treated me for a suspected minor stroke allessandro came back and picked us up and took us back to the hotel. this man did not have to do any of this for us and in my mind he went far beyond what any other hotelliers would have done.I would thoroughly reccommend to anyone wishing to stay in pompeii. the staff will give you all the information you need about the ruins , buses , trains and other local places to visit.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, conventient to the train and ruins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for four nights. The rooms are immaculate and the staff are so nice, most of them english speaking. Also, there's a lovely breakfast and the hotel is a literal walk away from the Pompei site. There's a selection of restaurants that are fab, the hotel staff reccomend a few and they are well worth a visit. This is an overall bargain hotel that is really well worth the money! Forget Sorrento and the other touristy areas-comparison prices make staying in Pompei much better.
reviews.title: Lovely, friendly and immaculate hotel!

reviews.text: Visit: Pompei, Mount Vesuvius (fantastic) and Paestum, which is down the coast (an amazing drive) and well worth it, the temples are breathtaking. Have to say we found Herculaneum really interesting but not for the feint hearted-has a very heavy oppressive feeling (understandable I suppose after what happened to it), we fled after about an hour!-strangely though Pompei doesn't feel that way.
reviews.title: Family of Five

reviews.text: Also, head out to Pompei town square at night, it comes alive after 9pm, scooters and the young hang out. Great atmosphere. It's great if you hire a car but the train service is also very good. Driving is quite an experience but you get used to the flow of things!
reviews.title: An Oasis
Excellently located hotel with friendly helpful staff
reviews.text: Family of Five. The best hotel we've stayed at in all of Europe! Perhaps the hotel is new. It was immaculately clean. The air conditioning was fully at our control and actually capable of making the room cold. It was slightly cramped with 2 adults and three children (13, 11, & 10 years old) in the one room, but still comfortable - one queen sized bed and two singles in a room probably designed as wheel-chair friendly (the bathroom was definitely designed for use for the handicapped). The room we stayed in was number "1".
The staff were extremely interested in making our stay enjoyable and comfortable. From the time we arrived until we departed, they were genuinely and enthusiastically ready to guide/help us.
reviews.title: Would return!

likes.liked: — The room decor which was reminiscent of the ruins.

reviews.text: We arrived at night and missed our turn off but found the hotel eventually without much trouble. The parking was safe and easy but I wouldn't like to have a bigger car! The staff were incredibly helpful with restaurants and train times and they were always friendly. Breakfast was pretty good. We had fresh fruit - plums, nectarines, pears, oranges, apples; beautiful croissants and good cappuccino. The beds were firm and the room small but very clean and comfortable. The location was very close to the town centre and restaurants but a long way from the main entrance to the ruins which is where the meeting place for guides is situated. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly hosts and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After arriving on an over-night flight from Canada via Munich to Naples, we quickly located this wonderful little hotel. We found the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. We chose this hotel because of the proximity to the attractions we wanted to visit, plus the free on-site parking, and the fact restaurants were within walking distance. We were only staying here one night, in order to visit Pompei the following morning (10 min. walk,) and then Mt. Vesuvius in the afternoon. After talking to the hotel staff, it was suggested that if the weather was clear in the morning, that it would be best to climb Vesuvius first. This is what we did, and the weather was clear. We returned to the hotel to park the car while we toured Pompei. Sure enough, the weather changed, and Vesuvius was engulfed in cloud in the afternoon, and it rained just after we finished Pompei, so it is possible Mt. Vesuvius may have been closed. We needed the hotel staff to park our car twice and get it out onto the street for us as the parking was very tight to say the least. Always done with a smile. The breakfast was simple but adequate, the room while not large was clean and more than adequate, and the little garden / patio was great for a nice cold beer when we arrived. You won't go wrong staying here.
reviews.title: Nice and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed with everything about Hotel Diana. The knowledgeable, friendly staff, the location (walk to ruins), the reasonable price, the dining recommendations, the breakfast.....all were excellent. They care about the details and focus on client service. You can tell this hotel is very well managed and the staff really care. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Diana just one night, but wished we could have stayed for more. The hosts were very attentive and the garden was the perfect place to relax with a glass of wine and a book after a long couple of days of travelling.
reviews.title: Perfect place to relax and regroup

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and they were even nice enough to hold on to our luggage after checkout while we toured the ruins of Pompeii.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Just a brief one night stay. The staff were very helpful. The room was basic but clean and comfortable. The morning breakfast was simple but adequate. The cappuccinos were excellent. Got some great dining advice from the desk. It was Saturday night and the streets outside our room were a little rowdy, so I was glad I had my earplugs. No reason I can see not to choose this hotel if you're visiting.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, convenient to both town and the ruins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picked this hotel for price and location. It's not 2 minutes from the main station serving Napoli, local station to sorrento is a €12 taxi ride away. A few mins from the main square and less than 5 from the ruins. Ideal if you want to get to the ruins and arrive before all the masses from coaches and trains arrive. Enjoyed our stay here.
reviews.title: Ideal location - minutes from ruins, main square and station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed only one night in Hotel Diana. The staff were very welcoming and informative. The rooms were spotless, spacious and the bed was comfortable. Couldn't really find a fault in the place. It's nice to have a drink at their outdoor garden area too. In terms of location; it was well placed to find it from the train station and then only a short walk to the ruins. I would most definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in an excellent location.

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Diana. The staff, especially Alessandro, is very friendly and knowledgeable (follow his suggestions for restaurants). The hotel is very clean and well run. The only 2 points that could be improved upon are: breakfast selection was modest, so could benefit from a slightly larger selection; wifi was a bit sporatic- seems fine in the morning when few people are using it, but in the afternoon, it was slow.
reviews.title: Hotel Diana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here whilst visiting Pompeii ruins recently. Oohing flash at all but good value for money and very neat clean and tidy. Staff were always helpful but breakfast a little limited and bed needed and update.
reviews.title: Good hotel with helpful staff

reviews.text: Hotel Diana, Pompeii is excellent from the minute you arrive at the front door !!
reviews.title: Definately chose Hotel Diana, Pompeii

likes.liked: — Staff were Excellent, Great Value, Location, Fresh fruit trees
likes.disliked: — There was nothing to dislike here

reviews.title: friendly, helpful, sparkling clean in Pompei
reviews.text: We arrived quite early morning and the young lady on reception greeted us with a gorgeous welcoming smile. Our room was still occupied so she arranged another room and let us check in. Then she showed us to the breakfast room where we had a nice simple breakfast. You would not find another hotel with such lovely young ladies on Reception. In fact all the staff at Hotel Diana greets you with smiles. The Hotel is only 3 minutes walk from the Bus Stop or Train Station, and about 7 mins walk to the Ruins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the ground floor and it was sparkling clean and very comfortable. There was a lovely courtyard at the rear of the hotel and it was surrounded by fruit trees laden with oranges and mandarines (and you were allowed to pick them and enjoy them).
reviews.title: Great value

likes.disliked: — Noisy room due to thin walls.

reviews.text: When we made our lunch for the following day, the girls were only too happy to store it in their refrigerator for our early trip the next morning. Nothing seemed to be a trouble to the staff at Hotel Diana.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.text: Sonya and Emi and all the staff thankyou for welcoming us and the great stay - I will recommend this Hotel to all Aussies travelling to Pompeii .
reviews.title: Diamond in the Rough

likes.liked: — sold us beers to enjoy in the garden /location
likes.disliked: — the rooms were just a little too small.

reviews.text: We LOVED this hotel. Clean, comfortable, very cute, and the staff are extraordinarily friendly and helpful. Really the best hotel we stayed in during our trip to Italy. We booked a quad, a triple, and a double and every room was super.
reviews.title: Wonderful Pompei Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel! Located very close to the train station (the station where national trains comes in like from Rome, etc.) There is another train station the is for shorter distances (like Naples and Sorrento) which is located about 10 mins via bus from the hotel. Anyway, about the hotel, it was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitly recommend this hotel and stay there again. Just a tip about the ruins: BRING PLENTY OF WATER!!!!!! We visited after coming in from a flight from the USA and were jet lagged. We weren't really thinking about water or the essentials when we visited. We regretted it when we were making a trek because the ruins are HUGE. There is a place where you can buy water, but it is far into the ruins (especially from the enterance you'll take if you stay at Hotel Diana). Enjoy and have a great time!
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: The town of Pompei is at best kind of dumpy. When we arrived around the rush hour, we were sure we would be involved in a car accident because the traffic was absolutely crazy. We perservered through the traffic until we found our hotel down a desolated alley. The hotel itself immediately looked pleasant in a hectic area. We were warmly greeted at the door, and were personally escorted to our room up two flights of stairs. We were VERY impressed with the room, the bathroom, and the decor. This place was clean, clean, clean. We loved it. A/C worked great, and after a hot day at the ruins, we needed it. The breakfast was very limited, but very well presented and great coffee. The hotel also has a Free parking area behind it for about 10 cars, which is plenty since I think there are only about 20 rooms. They lock a gate at night also at about midnight so you car is is safe. We could walk easily to the ruins. The staff at this hotel was by far the friendliest of any in all of our European trip. They bent over backwards to help us in directions and restaurant choices, and every one they recommeded was perfect and reasonalby priced. This is a different town, but enjoy it, the people are most warm and friendly.
reviews.title: Wonderful Gem in a crazy town

reviews.text: What a beautiful little hotel. Just a short stroll from the train station and a short, but pretty walk away from the ruins. We loved our stay. Very freindly staff...clean rooms....air conditioning worked well....great drinks....staff were welcoming and helpful.
reviews.title: Amazing Little Hotel

reviews.text: Grazie!
reviews.title: Another happy visitor

likes.liked: — Freindly, clean and new, free parking

reviews.text: This is the true gem of Pompei. It is right near the train station and is in a very safe location. There are citrus trees in the courtyard which you are free to pick fruit from. The breakfast in the morning is great as well. No cons.
reviews.title: The gem of Pompei
The staff so helpful and friendly
reviews.text: Diana is a small friendly hotel just off the main town square, the ancient ruins and public transport system, are both a stroll away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are wonderful, they were always helpful and friendly. Diana only offers B&B but the reception staff can recommend plenty of local restaurants offering a taste of Italy.
reviews.title: Oasis in Pompei

reviews.text: The hotel was spotless, bed linen and towels smelt so fresh.
reviews.title: What a gem

likes.disliked: — room was a little small, but fine for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend the hotel to anyone (and hope I can still get booked next time!)
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise...Great New Hotel

description: This recently renovated hotel with modern and glamour refinements is winner of the Italian Hospitality Awards 2007 3-star category.Ideally located for public transport users, walking distance from the ruins and the famous Sanctuary.Geogeous garden with orange trees, lemon hedges and typically Mediterranean plants.On request we can organizes wonderful excursion to: Naples; Sorrento; Amalfi; Positano; and Mount Vesuvius.
